data.title: Delicious Tex- Mex Lunch
data.text: Although its only open at lunch, locals from the nearby courthouse   area flock here at for its reasonable prices and delicious and classic tex-mex fare! Great homestyle cooking and fast counter service in a casual setting, leave you satisfied!

data.title: Lunch Tacos
data.text: We had Barbacoa, Carne Guisada, and Chorrizo with Egg tacos.  All the tacos had plenty of subsistence in each of the selected tacos.  Flavor was average.

data.title: Outstanding Food for the Value!
data.text:
If you’ve read any of my other reviews, you know I don’t usually just get hungry and stumble into the nearest restaurant around. I try to research and plan where I’ll eat, read some reviews, look at the menus, etc. That usually works quite well for me, with the only exceptions being when I just can’t find the place, give up, and settle because I’m starving.

When I was recently in downtown San Antonio, I began the research on places to get a great, authentic Tex-Mex meal for lunch. Needless to say, there is no shortage of places serving that in this area.  Which made the research even more important. I was only going to be there for 2 days…I wanted the best food possible. I’d had an excellent Tex-Mex meal 2 days before, so this one should equal or exceed that one.

When I saw that Poblanos on Main was just a few blocks (walking distance) from the hotel, and it was tex-mex, I wanted to know more. So I read the reviews. I did not find one single review that gave this place a 3, 2, or 1. All reviewers rated Poblanos 4 or 5.  What? ALWAYS before there is someone dissatisfied with something!  Maybe the silverware on the table wasn’t straight, or the salt didn’t pour on the first shake…SOMETHING!  But not here!  4 or 5 across the board. Well..I was hooked…I HAD to go there and see what this place was all about! If for no other reason than the uniqueness of having NO average or below reviews.

My GPS is my best friend. I use it everywhere. However, it was a little tricky to use it in San Antonio, because of the Riverwalk; sometimes you need to be street level, sometimes Riverwalk level, and I hadn’t quite figured it out yet. So by the time I found the place, I was definitely hungry.  

Walking in reminded me of a school cafeteria. You order and pay at the front window from a men posted overhead behind the counter.  Your receipt assigns the number—which is called when the order is ready. There are no servers, definitely not ‘fine dining’ in the service sense, but I venture to say fine dining in the food and value sense. I ordered Enchiladas Poblano having no real idea what they’d be like. They were the best ever!  Their own cream sauce covering the enchiladas was to die for! The chips (which don’t come with the meal and need to be ordered too) were fresh, thin, made there in the restaurant, and the sauce was just like I love…hot spicy, smooth and flavorful.  There was everything good and nothing bad about the quality of the food, the taste, and the price. What an outstanding value for such a quality meal. Sure, you have to walk to the counter a few times, but it is a small sacrifice given the meal you’re about consume. And sure, it requires a little searching and scratching the head while looking at GPS, but in the end it is totally worth it.  I’m only sorry I wasn’t in town long enough to try one of their breakfasts. I can only dream about them until I get back to San Antonio next.  This place will be a must stop from now on!

data.title: Great Authentic Mexican
data.text:
Good food at a fair price, no frills.  Order at the counter and pick up when ready.
Had the huevos rancheros.  Eggs done your way.  With diced potatos, refried beans and bacon. Very good.  Only $6.16 with tax.  Half the price and twice the quality of any place on the riverwalk a block away.
Open only for breakfast and lunch.

data.title: Favorite item is the chicken fajita salad
data.text: I eat here regularly since i work about a block away.   As stated above my favorite it the chicken fajita salad.

data.title: Unassuming little place with good food
data.text: I work near here and come often for the lunch specials. The food has always been quite good and the lunch specials are good bargains.

data.title: Breakfast/brunch!
data.text: Really good refried beans and chorizo breakfast taco. Lots of food for the money.  Potatoes were just plain.  Staff was pleasant, and food was cooked quickly.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Went in for lunch while in town. Everyone was very friendly and the food was excellent. Had a special for grilled ranchero chicken rice beans tortillas and a tea for 8$. It was great almost too much food. Everything tastes like it was fresh and homemade. We ordered chips and salsa and they were great as well. The chips were very thin (just how I like them) and the salsa was warm(heat not spice) I had never had it this way, but it was great.

data.title: Good spot downtown!
data.text: I came close to rating this "very good" but it doesn't quite get there.  Still, worth a stop for a good meal when you just need good food.  The place is not very interesting to look at and there is little to no ambiance.  But for in and out food, I would say do it!

data.title: Good Value Cafeteria Style Mexican Food
data.text: Stopped in at Poblanos on my way back from the market. It's tucked in to a building beside the old church. It's a cafeteria style Mexican restaurant and was busy with church goers. The service was friendly and the prices were very reasonable. The portion was HUGE for what I paid. The food wasn't anything special, but it was totally fine given the context and price. If anything, I would suggest smaller portions and/or higher prices and go a little more upscale on the food (though not much).

data.title: Visit after Sunday Mass, Come quick!
data.text:
This is the place to visit with friends and family after 10:00 mass, It is right next door to San Fernando Cathedral. Most of the congregation came here to eat and visit.
If you are not sure of the menu (because there are a lot of choices) ask when you are ordering at the counter. Our server told us about the "tacos chilaquiles", very good especially with adding their table salsa. 
Very inexpensive, tasty and would come again to try their "menudo" that is only served on Sundays.
Took our trays back up to the counter because we weren't sure where to take them and the place was getting crowded.

data.title: Best Poblanos Enchiladas!
data.text: These enchiladas are delicious. On Wednesday, they are served as a lunch special with beans and rice and tortillas. They have an authentic flavor and is definitely a must try if you are in the area.

data.title: Okay
data.text: Ate there with a large group. The guy decided to take everyone's order at once and put it on one ticket. Fine except the servers didn't know who ordered what. Big mess. Mine was okay. Very bland. Almost tasteless. Was not impressed and probably won't go back.

data.title: My choice for quick, tasty & affordable
data.text: I work downtown and visit Poblano's almost every other week. They offer great breakfast & lunch specials , tasty and affordable . I would recommend the Poblano's enchiladas, nachos, tortilla soup. Portions are great as well and they offer outdoor seating for those nice days. Friendly Staff, clean restaurant, never had any issues in the last couple years I've been going. This is the new location behind off commerce and flores, the old one off commerce and main burned down , but this is definitely a better location.

data.title: Delightful find
data.text: Poblanos is alongside the Cathedral. When we walked in we thought it felt more like a company canteen than a restaurant, it was busy with lots of people who appeared to have come from local offices and the court house. We enquired about the Tortilla Soup and were met by very friendly staff only too willing to help. The soup lived up to their recommendation, it was very tasty, with lots of chicken meat. The staff were kind enough to bring the food to our table, understanding that we'd never have recognised our number called out in Spanish! We had an inexpensive meal which we thoroughly enjoyed.

data.title: Nice place
data.text: Located at the Main Plaza, adjacent to San Fernando Cathedral, this quaint place is great for an economical and tasty meal. The staff was very friendly. It's not fancy, not great atmostsphere, just a great place to go for a quick bite.

data.title: Great authentic food
data.text: We really enjoyed eating out in the courtyard with great homemade chips and queso.  Excellent options and Mexican Coca Cola. :) Worth a stop. It may be a bit out of the way. We found it after visiting the Spanish Governor's Palace.

data.title: Nice Find Close to Court House
data.text: Leave it to jury duty to find this great family owned place.  Great Mexican restaurant with ample room and more importantly great food.  Stopped here for lunch on the recommendation of a friend and it was outstanding.  Had the soft tacos and chips and salsa.  Tacos are uniquely prepared with a ranchero sauce that was really great.  Everything homemade.  Friendly and fast service.  Will absolutely eat here again when downtown.

data.title: Better off choosing Taco Bell
data.text: This is not a quality tex-mex experience.  The food is flavorless, unimaginative and not quite up to par with Taco Bell.  We in San Antonio pride ourselves on our traditional Mexican food, our Tex-Mex spin on Mexican food and, down home chili flavored "diner" cuisine which comforts us all with Mexican spices.  Sadly, Poblanos doesn't do any of that.

data.title: Breakfast Tacos!
data.text: Wish we had found this place our first day in SA instead of our last. Got the breakfast tacos and they were delicious! We will definitely eat here on our next trip!
